comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to several NYT articles, the Gull was owned by a Daniel Asay, of the North Shrewsbury Ice Yacht Club. See for example NYT of Feb 22, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E07E6DC1E39E633A...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: More on the owner (Daniel V. Asay) at www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=23307487

comment.author: 52894347@N03
comment._content: Daniel V. Asay was my great-great-grandfather and the Gull was built for him by Joseph Lake. I haven't yet discovered the exact year it was built but it was mentioned in an article in the Red Bank Register as early as 1906. He sold it in 1917 to Robert Johnson.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: In February, 1914, entrants from the North Shrewsbury and South Shrewsbury Ice Yacht Clubs contentended for the annual North American Ice Yacht championship on the Shrewsbury River, in Red Bank, New Jersey. Here's the report in the New York Times, February 16, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=940CE...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
